title: AB 2468
content: The people of California enact the following. Section 7522.20 of the Government Code is amended to specify the retirement age and pension calculation for nonsafety members of the system. The defined benefit plan provides a pension based on the member's age at retirement and years of service. Members can retire after five years of service and at the age of 52 or older. The retirement age and pension calculation for nonsafety members of the system are specified in Section 7522.20 of the Government Code. The defined benefit plan provides a pension based on the member's age at retirement and years of service. Members can retire after five years of service and at the age of 52 or older. Pension amounts are determined based on increments of 1/4, 1/2, or 3/4 as the member's age increases. The retirement age and pension calculation for nonsafety members of the system are specified in Section 7522.20 of the Government Code. Pension amounts are determined based on increments of 1/4, 1/2, or 3/4 as the member's age increases, ranging from 1.700 to 2.350. Pensionable compensation for defined benefit calculation is limited as per Section 7522.10. New members of the State Teachers’ Retirement System follow formula in Section 24202.6 of the Education Code. Public agencies under contract with the Public Employees’ Retirement System may use formula in Section 21354.6 for new members. Section 21354.6 is added to the Government Code. Section 21354.6 of the Government Code allows contracting agencies to apply a specific formula to new miscellaneous, nonsafety employees hired after January 1, 2017, with agreement from the employee organization. The Government Code allows contracting agencies to apply a specific formula for pension benefits for nonsafety employees. Retirement benefits are based on a percentage of final compensation and years of service, with retirement possible after five years of state service and reaching 55 years of age. The curr_chunk provides a list of pension benefits based on final compensation and years of service for nonsafety employees, with retirement possible after five years of state service and reaching 55 years of age. The chunk includes increments of 1/4, 1/2, and 3/4 for each increase in age from 56 to 62. The curr_chunk lists pension benefits for nonsafety employees based on final compensation and years of service, with retirement possible after five years of state service and reaching 55 years of age. The benefits increase in increments of 1/4, 1/2, and 3/4 for each age from 56 to 68. The curr_chunk outlines pension benefits for nonsafety employees based on final compensation and years of service, with retirement possible after five years of state service and reaching 55 years of age. The benefits increase in increments of 1/4, 1/2, and 3/4 for each age from 56 to 70. Additionally, it states that unless permitted by law, nonsafety employees not defined as new members shall be subject to a specific benefit formula if employed by a public employer that did not contract with the system before December 31, 2012. Pensionable compensation for defined benefits is limited as described in Section 7522.10.
